00014 int main(int argc,char *argv[])
00015 {
00016   int server_port;
00017   int sock,sock2;
00018   struct sockaddr_in sa,sa2;
00019   int rc,i;
00020   fd_set readlist;
00021   fd_set connections;
00022   int maxfd;
00023 
00024   /* parse command line args */
00025   if (argc != 3)
00026   {
00027     fprintf(stderr, "usage: http_server1 k|u port\n");
00028     exit(-1);
00029   }
00030   server_port = atoi(argv[2]);
00031   if (server_port < 1500)
00032   {
00033     fprintf(stderr,"INVALID PORT NUMBER: %d; can't be < 1500\n",server_port);
00034     exit(-1);
00035   }
00036 
00037   /* initialize and make socket */
00038   if (toupper(*(argv[1]))=='K') {
00039     minet_init(MINET_KERNEL);
00040   } else if (toupper(*(argv[1]))=='U') {
00041     minet_init(MINET_USER);
00042   } else {
00043     fprintf(stderr, "First argument must be k or u\n");
00044     exit(-1);
00045   }
00046   sock = minet_socket(SOCK_STREAM);
00047   if (sock < 0)
00048   {
00049     minet_perror("couldn't make socket\n");
00050     exit(-1);
00051   }
00052 
00053   /* set server address*/
00054   memset(&sa, 0, sizeof sa);
00055   sa.sin_port = htons(server_port);
00056   sa.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
00057   sa.sin_family = AF_INET;
00058 
00059   /* bind listening socket */
00060   rc = minet_bind(sock,&sa);
00061   if (rc < 0)
00062   {
00063 
00064     minet_perror("couldn't bind\n");
00065     exit(-1);
00066   }
00067 
00068   /* start listening */
00069   rc = minet_listen(sock,5);
00070   if (rc < 0)
00071   {
00072     minet_perror("couldn't listen\n");
00073     exit(-1);
00074   }
00075 
00076   /* connection handling loop */
00077   maxfd = sock;
00078   FD_ZERO(&connections);
00079   while(1)
00080   {
00081     /* create read list */
00082     FD_ZERO(&readlist);
00083     FD_SET(sock,&readlist);
00084     for (i = 0; i <= maxfd; i++)
00085     {
00086       if (FD_ISSET(i,&connections))
00087       {
00088                 FD_SET(i,&readlist);
00089         //printf("added socket %d from connections to readlist\n",i);
00090       }
00091     }
00092 
00093     /* do a select */
00094     rc = select(maxfd+1,&readlist,0,0,0);
00095     while ((rc < 0) && (errno == EINTR))
00096       rc = select(maxfd+1,&readlist,0,0,0);
00097     if (rc < 0)
00098     {
00099       minet_perror("select failed ");
00100       continue;
00101     }
00102 
00103     /* process sockets that are ready */
00104     for (i = 0; i <= maxfd; i++)
00105     {
00106       if (!(FD_ISSET(i,&readlist)))
00107         continue;
00108 
00109       /* for the accept socket, add accepted connection to connections */
00110       if (i == sock)
00111       {
00112         sock2 = minet_accept(sock,&sa2);
00113         if (sock2 < 0)
00114         {
00115           minet_perror("Couldn't accept a connection ");
00116           continue;
00117         }
00118         if (sock2 > maxfd)
00119           maxfd = sock2;
00120         FD_SET(sock2,&connections);
00121         //printf("accepted some connection on socket %d\n",sock2);
00122       }
00123       else /* for a connection socket, handle the connection */
00124       {
00125         //printf("connection socket %d ready, about to process connection\n",i);
00126         rc = handle_connection(i);
00127         FD_CLR(i,&connections);
00128         //printf("removed socket %d from connections\n",i);
00129         if (i == maxfd)
00130         {
00131           maxfd -= 1;
00132         }
00133       }
00134     }
00135   }
00136 }

00138 int handle_connection(int sock2)
00139 {
00140   char filename[FILENAMESIZE+1];
00141   int rc;
00142   int fd;
00143   struct stat filestat;
00144   char buf[BUFSIZE+1];
00145   char *headers;
00146   char *endheaders;
00147   char *bptr;
00148   int datalen=0;
00149   char *ok_response_f = "HTTP/1.0 200 OK\r\n"\
00150                       "Content-type: text/plain\r\n"\
00151                       "Content-length: %d \r\n\r\n";
00152   char ok_response[100];
00153   char *notok_response = "HTTP/1.0 404 FILE NOT FOUND\r\n"\
00154                          "Content-type: text/html\r\n\r\n"\
00155                          "<html><body bgColor=black text=white>\n"\
00156                          "<h2>404 FILE NOT FOUND</h2>\n"\
00157                          "</body></html>\n";
00158   bool ok=true;
00159 
00160   /* first read loop -- get request and headers*/
00161   while ((rc = minet_read(sock2,buf+datalen,BUFSIZE-datalen)) > 0)
00162   {
00163     datalen += rc;
00164     buf[datalen] = '\0';
00165     endheaders = strstr(buf,"\r\n\r\n");
00166     if (endheaders != NULL)
00167     {
00168       endheaders[2] = '\0';
00169       endheaders += 4;
00170       headers =(char *) malloc(strlen(buf)+1); //not used here, for future
00171       strcpy(headers,buf);
00172       break;
00173     }
00174   }
00175   if (rc < 0)
00176   {
00177       minet_perror("Error reading request\n");
00178       minet_close(sock2);
00179       return -1;
00180   }
00181 
00182   /* parse request to get file name */
00183   /* Assumption: this is a GET request and filename contains no spaces*/
00184   bptr = buf;
00185   strsep(&bptr," ");
00186   if (bptr == NULL) //Not a valid request
00187   {
00188       ok = false;
00189   }
00190   else
00191   {
00192     bptr = strsep(&bptr," ");
00193     if (strlen(bptr) > FILENAMESIZE)
00194       {
00195         fprintf(stderr,"Filename too big\n");
00196         minet_close(sock2);
00197         return -1;
00198       }
00199     if (bptr[0] == '/')
00200       bptr += 1;
00201     strcpy(filename,bptr);
00202 
00203     /* try opening the file */
00204     fd = open(filename,O_RDONLY);
00205     if (fd < 0)
00206       {
00207         ok = false;
00208         //printf("couldn't open file %s\n",filename);
00209       }
00210   }
00211 
00212   /* send response */
00213   if (ok)
00214   {
00215     /* send headers */
00216     rc = stat(filename,&filestat);
00217     if (rc < 0)
00218     {
00219       perror("error getting file stat ");
00220       minet_close(sock2);
00221       return -1;
00222     }
00223     sprintf(ok_response,ok_response_f,filestat.st_size);
00224     rc = writenbytes(sock2,ok_response,strlen(ok_response));
00225     if (rc < 0)
00226     {
00227       minet_perror("error writing response\n");
00228       minet_close(sock2);
00229       return -1;
00230     }
00231 
00232     /* send file */
00233     while ((rc = read(fd,buf,BUFSIZE)) != 0)
00234     {
00235       if (rc < 0)
00236       {
00237         fprintf(stderr,"error reading requested file %s\n",filename);
00238         break;
00239       }
00240       else
00241       {
00242         rc = writenbytes(sock2, buf, rc);
00243         if (rc < 0)
00244         {
00245           minet_perror("error writing response\n");
00246           minet_close(sock2);
00247           return -1;
00248         }
00249       }
00250     }
00251   }
00252   else
00253   {
00254     rc = writenbytes(sock2,notok_response,strlen(notok_response));
00255     if (rc < 0)
00256     {
00257       minet_perror("error writing response\n");
00258       minet_close(sock2);
00259       return -1;
00260     }
00261   }
00262 
00263   //free(headers);
00264   minet_close(sock2);
00265 
00266   if (ok)
00267     return 0;
00268   else
00269     return -1;
00270 }

00272 int readnbytes(int fd,char *buf,int size)
00273 {
00274   int rc = 0;
00275   int totalread = 0;
00276   while ((rc = minet_read(fd,buf+totalread,size-totalread)) > 0)
00277     totalread += rc;
00278 
00279   if (rc < 0)
00280   {
00281     return -1;
00282   }
00283   else
00284     return totalread;
00285 }

00287 int writenbytes(int fd,char *str,int size)
00288 {
00289   int rc = 0;
00290   int totalwritten =0;
00291   while ((rc = minet_write(fd,str+totalwritten,size-totalwritten)) > 0)
00292     totalwritten += rc;
00293 
00294   if (rc < 0)
00295     return -1;
00296   else
00297     return totalwritten;
00298 }
